<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: Iterator<DataSnapshot> iterator1 = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator();
Iterator<DataSnapshot> iterator2 = iterator1.next().getChildren().iterator();
while (iterator1.hasNext()) {
DataSnapshot dataSnapshot1 = iterator1.next();
DataSnapshot dataSnapshot2 = iterator2.next();
// Do something with dataSnapshot1 and dataSnapshot2
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use a nested loop or a while loop to iterate through multiple iterators. In this example, we create two iterators, one for each dataSnapshot, and then use a while loop to iterate through them. Each time the loop runs, it calls the next() method on the first iterator to get the next dataSnapshot, and then calls the next() method on the second iterator to get the next child of the first dataSnapshot.
